About Me

I’m a physicist and candidate of Master of Sciences in physics from the Universidad Nacional de Colombia, currently living in Bogotá D. C. I have experience in nuclear physics (theoretical and experimental). Also, I have over two years using machine learning methods and Bayesian inference. I want to apply all of this to practical physics projects.

My professional interests include nuclear physics, nuclear instrumentation, data analysis, bayesian inferences and, astronomy and software development in general.

Experience

Servicio Geológico Colombiano (SGC)

Regulatory Inspector

October 2018 - present

https://www.sgc.gov.co/

Physicist

Inspector of the regulatory authority in Colombia for the correct handling of radioactive materials in industry, medicine and science, through carry out technical guides, scientific reports and inspection visits of security verification and conditions.

Universidad Nacional de Colombia

Junior research

October 2018 - present

gfnun.unal.edu.co/

Physicist

Study of the environmental impact of 131 I and 99m Tc, in waste water from the Central Police Hospital of Colombia.

  • Using an HPGe detector with a fixed experimental geometry to determine the sample activity and the concentrations in ppm.
  • Carried out experimental sets up to obtain different volume of samples.
  • Software development for data analysis.

Universidad Nacional de Colombia

Junior research

October 2018 - present

gfnun.unal.edu.co/

Junior research

Design of new analytic methods for $\gamma$ spectroscopy applied to basic research focused on:

  • Software development for gamma spectroscopy analyses employing C++ and Python.
  • Characterization of efficiency and resoluction for HPGe detectors, scintillator detectors such as NaI(2x2), NaI(3x3), CsI(2x2), BGO(2x2) detectors, among others.
  • Modeling of extended source and position optimization for HPGe detector.
